reviewText: Celtic Thunder and "Heritage" are a bright, shining light in this world of darkness. I've had the DVD for a few weeks now and my wife & I have watched it over and over, and we absolutely LOVE it. My daughter, who is 31, came up for a visit. I put on Heritage and she, too, was awed by the performance of these guys and their marvelous accompaniment. She has the DVD now, too. My brother, in his mid-60's, also loves the group. When the camera pans across the audience, you see toddlers, teens, middle-age, and older folks, and it is easy to see why: Celtic Thunder's music is wholesome, happy, heart-warming, and their performance is SUPERB from start to finish.But for me, the icing on the cake is more than just their singing ability... it's the genuine affection the guys have for one another and the passionate rendering of every song they sing, straight from the heart.Some have complained of a cheap looking backdrop and of the songs being lip synched. But I just sat back and took in the magnificence of the singing and the entire act, and thoughts of those things never even entered my mind -- the singing ALONE was THAT good.But a warning about the Heritage AUDIO CD: 3 songs that are on the DVD are NOT on the audio CD (Heartland, Irelands's Call, Belfast Polka). I agree with another reviewer that whatever songs are on the DVD should be exactly the songs that are on the audio CD, and vice versa. After all, that's what people expect. If they're going to change the songs, it should be stated plainly on the cover that this has been done, rather than people finding out about it with disappointment AFTER the product arrives.I HIGHLY recommend the Heritage DVD, and in a special way to parents with children from toddlers to teens. That's so their kids can experience excellence in music early in life, and hopefully continue down that path for their musical entertainment. That, intead of the audible trash that's marketed as "music" these days.

reviewText: I really love this group, but to be honest this the best Concert DVD since the first one.  Back to the more traditional music of Ireland.  Plus the fact that the group has gotten better and better as the years go by.  Damian, who was only 16 when the concerts started has aged to a handsome young man and still has that beautiful voice and those incredible blue eyes.  The rest of the group has also matured into older versions of themselves and still maintained the style and voices that made them famous.  If you liked the first and second concert DVD's then you will love this one.
summary: As usual Celtic Thunders new concert DVD is great
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's here!!  It's here!!  It actually felt like Christmas as I sat down last night to watch "Heritage".  This is even better than I remembered and the guys' interactions are so much better than you could see from the audience.  The only "downer" came when I opened the CD and learned that Paul Byrom will be leaving CT and has been replaced by Emmet Cahill - more about that in my CD review.  Seriously, this DVD gets better and better - you just want to sing and clap your hands on Home From the Sea and A Place in the Choir.  As a finale, it's hard to top Ireland's Call, but "Place" is so jolly and fun that it literally lifts you up - especially when Damian takes over with what Phil Coulter calls his "dark brown voice!"  Neil's "Noreen" is hauntingly beautiful - and I'm so glad he shaved off that chin hair/goatee or whatever it was.  The band's "Belfast Polka" is so jolly it makes you want to dance in the aisles, and they all look as though they're having a whale of a time - it just shows in their expressions and in the amazing number of instruments they use.When I first wrote this, it was based on what they performed in concert.  While I wasn't by any means disappointed in the concert, seeing it on DVD is even better because you literally have a front-row seat for all the fun - and it's obvious that they all enjoy what they're doing.  It's also nice to watch the people in the audience as the night progresses.  These are the songs that reviewers pining for true Irish music have been asking for, and I assure you nobody will be disappointed.  Once again, we see each of the guys doing their own thing, but it's when they get into the group music and the duets that it pulls at your heartstrings and has you tapping your toes. This time, they've paired Paul and Damian, Ryan and George, and Keith and Neil, and the results are some of the best music they've done thus far.  Be sure you listen to the lyrics - some of them will pull at your heartstrings.Luckily, I am a wee bit Irish, but even if I weren't, I'd claim Celtic Thunder!  Good job guys, I'm lookin' forward to next fall's tour.  Did I hear correctly that there's a "Storm" coming?  If so, I can't wait!!!  Paul, you definitely be missed, but I look forward to following your solo career.  Amazon - you came thru for me on opening day - THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!  Ryan from Customer Service - you are the man, and I thank you so very much.
summary: Makes you wish you were Irish too!!

reviewText: I saw the show on November 19 in Pensacola, Fla.  I had more fun that night than I have had in years at a concert.  The music was awesome and, of course, there was the bonus of having some fine gentlemen on stage to look at.....lolol.  And to make it an even more awesome evening, when we were headed for our car we passed their bus out back and they got off (all except George) and we got to meet them, take their pics and have them sign our programs... that was an unexpected surprise.  We didn't even know their bus was back there. It was just absolutely great.  The DVD is like reliving the show over and over again.  I will be in an audience this fall to see them again.  Highly recommend buying the DVD and CD.
summary: Best, most entertaining show I have ever seen

reviewText: Buy this immediately!!!  You will be so glad you did.  This is their best performance yet.  The duet with Paul and Damian of "Loves Old Sweet Song" is dreamily romantic.  The instrumental number "Dublin Polka" is done with just the Celtic Thunder band and the piano player is up on the stage on keyboard.  They now have the original tin whistle player back.  He was missing from "Act 2" and I didn't like the substitute.  He seemed like it was just a job and didn't bring in the energy and life to his performance that the original did.Keith and Neil rock the house with "Whiskey in the Jar."  "Galway Girl" which is on the CD was NOT on the concert.  On the flip side, "Sky Boat" which is on the DVD is not on the CD.Each performer got 1 solo and 1 duet in addition to the ensemble numbers.  Neil adds a lot to the ensemble and they should have had him singing a long time ago.The last number, "Place in the Choir" is a little nonsense song that the guys really seemed to love doing.  They had a small dance routine worked out and it was just a touch of comedy.  All in all you will LOVE "Heritage"  I know I do.

reviewText: I was just given this DVD by,of all people,my Italian neighbor,who knows my great love of Irish Music and Culture.I don't know how come,but I had never heard of this group or this show.I am of,of course,very familiar with the the great Phil Coulter and all his wonderful music and songs.He and Pete St John are the best of the best from Ireland.All the songs on this DVD are some of the most popular and best loved songs that one expects to hear in Irish Shows,Concerts,Pubs,or anywhere Irish gather for entertainment or craic.Quite rightfully,this is called Celtic,and it does have a couple of Scottish songs,but Coulter's involvement gives them a Irish touch.The Irish have the ability to take any song and make it their own.One only has to think of that popular Irish song,"Maggie" .It was written by a schoolteacher,near Hamilton,Ontario.In case you are not familiar with this DVD,it is a recording of a complete show.I am not sure where it was recorded.I suspect it was in Ireland,,maybe it shows in the credits,but I didn't see it.So,if you have a hankering for a great Irish show ,concert,or just want to listen to the music;look no further,you'll find it right here.
summary: The Irish have a word for something as good as this,BRILLIANT!!

reviewText: "Heritage" may not be the best DVD that Celtic Thunder had put out, but it's close to the top.  Living in a tiny town in middle-west America, we don't get concerts here, so the best I can get is DVDs.  Of special note on "Heritage" is "The Dutchman."  I don't think I've ever heard a more touching song, very well done by Keith Harkin.  Besides purchasing the DVD, I have downloaded the MP3 so I can have it on a CD also.One thing I've noticed (and enjoyed) is that the Celtic Thunder boys had relaxed a lot more than they did in the earlier DVDs. Ryan and Paul were always pretty animated and cheerful (even silly), but Kevin, Damian and George seemed to me to be pretty stiff and nervous.  Now they seem relaxed and seem to be enjoying themselves.I'm just a tish concerned about the new guy, Emmit Cahill.  He seems very young and Paul Byrom is leaving some pretty BIG shoes to be filled. He obviously has potential, but I'm anxious to see what he can do in a full concert.And I wish Paul Byrom the very best as he strikes out alone.
summary: Heritage, and goodbye Paul, hello Emmit

reviewText: This is the only one I have of this group. Several times I have listened on the utube and liked their music, but for whatever reason was reluctant to purchase a DVD. One day I decided to see if they were still recording and sure enough there was "Heritage." Nice cover! Just had a good feeling about it, and ordered it.I am very pleased with this DVD, and have watched it four or five times already. The new guy has a good voice and nice delivery; good addition to the group. Word is that this is Paul's last recording with this group.  Another reason to be glad that I ordered it.  The price was great, -well worth it. I like this DVD because it is good, and I like it because it is different! There are not too many entertainers that I care to watch for that long at one sitting.The children in the audience are getting into the music for sure. My children are grown, but this would also be good family entertainment. Looking forward to sharing it as often as opportunity affords.Buy it, and enjoy it. If you do, it will lighten your day, and maybe even bring a smile.Mickey Thorne

reviewText: I lean toward more authentic, traditional Irish music and bands, but , although Celtic Thunder is a commercial enterprise geared toward American style "Celtic" music, I really enjoyed their first show on PBS due to the great personalities of the guys and their lovely and individually unique voices, along with their ability to perform traditional songs in a way that will appeal to a large audience without losing the soul of the songs (unlike Celtic Woman, which I deplore.)But after the original show, with each consecutive show, Celtic Thunder became more packaged, commercial and cheesy and less Celtic. Rock bottom came with the last show, "It's Entertainment" causing me to vow to never watch another Celtic Thunder performance! However, when I heard that their new show "Heritage" was to bring them back to their Celtic roots, I decided to have one more look. I have to say this was my favorite of all the shows, even surpassing the original. Gone are the cheesy suits and cheesier dance numbers, gone are the show tune covers that have been done better a million times before, gone is the woman singing Cher tunes... and we have just a bunch of talented men doing their own versions of traditional and a few modern Celtic tunes, and really great, fun versions at that! All I can think is that "It's Entertainment" either drew a ton of criticism or brought in very little revenue, probably both, and it was decided to regroup and produce something that highlighted the strengths and talents of these performers. "Heritage" was such a delight to watch on PBS that I'm purchasing the dvd!
